translated: Elder’s Birth Stories
The Chapter with Padumuttara at the Head
The Elder Taraṇiya’s Story
The One Perfected, the One of Golden Beauty,
Vipassī, worthy of offerings,
The Teacher, standing on the riverbank,
with the Community of monks in front of him,
There was no boat to be found there,
to cross over in the great ocean;
Having gone down to the river,
I crossed over the Leader of the World.
For ninety-one eons,
I crossed over the Supreme One among Men;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the result of crossing over.
The four analytical insights,
… and so on …
I have done what the Awakened One has recommended.”🔽Thus the elder Taraṇiya recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā taraṇiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Taraṇiyattherassāpadānaṁ dasamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā taraṇiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati  taraṇiya therassa apadānam dasama
translated: The Elder Taraṇiya’s Story, the tenth.
The twenty-seventh chapter is called “Padumuttara at the Head.”
The summary:
Lifting up, oil lamp, and moon,
and the lamp, and the cat,
fish, swift, and the six-tusker,
demon, and Taraṇiya, the tenth;
The verses here are reckoned to be

analyzed: tālīsam ca ekam eva ca ati
translated: thirty-one.
